Key Match Events: De’Aaron Fox recorded a double-double with 29 points, 10 assists, 6 rebounds, 2 steals, and 1 block.
The Kings shot 68% from the field and 58% from three-point range, leading to a 127-104 victory.
Post-Match Reflections: De’Aaron Fox set the tone with his aggressiveness and attacking the basket, leading the Kings' fast-paced offense.
The Kings outscored the Suns 68-48 in the second half, showcasing improved ball movement and defense.
DeMar DeRozan did not return to the game due to lower back tightness.
Keegan Murray made a significant block in the third quarter, helping swing momentum back to the Kings.
The Kings' bench contributed significantly, with Trey Lyles scoring 13 points and Jordan McLaughlin adding 11 points.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Kings forced the Suns to pull their starters with around five minutes left in the fourth quarter.
DeMar DeRozan’s absence impacted the team's performance, but the Kings showed resilience with a strong fourth-quarter run.
